accelerated_claims.name: Evict a tenant using accelerated possession
accelerated_claims.description: The system helps step the user through the creation of an N5B, Claim form for Possession of Property).  The resultant PDF must be printed and posted to the court along with the fee and required documents

grc-app.name: Apply for a Gender Recognition Certificate
grc-app.description: Apply for a Gender Recognition Certificate if you want your affirmed gender (sometimes called an ‘acquired gender’) to be legally recognised in the UK.
grc-app.theme: Citizenship and living in the UK

laa-apply-for-legal-aid.name: Apply for legal aid
laa-apply-for-legal-aid.description: This service enables citizens and their solicitors to submit means and capital information, with supporting evidence, and solicitors to submit merit information.

cla_public.name: Check if you can get legal aid
cla_public.description: Legal aid can help pay for legal advice.You’ll be asked general questions about your legal problem and your income and savings. You’ll be told where you can get legal advice.

laa-estimate-financial-eligibility-for-l.name: Check if your client qualifies for legal aid
laa-estimate-financial-eligibility-for-l.description: Use this service to find out if your client is likely to get civil legal aid, based on their financial situation.

links.text: News story: Civil news: online eligibility tool launched for providers

fala.name: Find a legal aid adviser or family mediator
fala.description: Search for a legal adviser or family mediator with a legal aid contract in England and Wales.

find-unclaimed-court-money.name: Find unclaimed court money
find-unclaimed-court-money.description: You can find and claim money you're entitled to from a civil court in England and Wales if it has not been claimed.

hwf-publicapp.name: Get help paying court and tribunal fees
hwf-publicapp.description: You might be able to get money off your court or tribunal fees if you have little or no savings, are on certain benefits or have a low income. There are different ways of applying for help with fees for the Court of Protection and the First-Tier Immigration and Asylum Tribunal.

help-with-child-arrangements.name: Get help with child arrangements
help-with-child-arrangements.description: Use this guide if you need to make or change child arrangements (also known as contact, access or custody) with the other parent.

help-with-prison-visits-external.name: Get help with the cost of prison visits
help-with-prison-visits-external.description: If you visit a family member, partner or someone who doesn’t get other visitors you might be able to get help paying for: travel to the prisonsomewhere to stay overnight, meals. You must be getting certain benefits or have a health certificate to get help.

prison-visits-public.name: Visit someone in prison
prison-visits-public.description: Use this service to book a social visit to a prisoner in England or Wales.

send-legal-mail-to-prisons.name: Send legal mail to prisons
send-legal-mail-to-prisons.description: Use this service to create barcodes and addresses to display in your legal correspondence or confidential access mail if your organisation or role is listed in the guidance on monitoring and managing prisoner communications.

money-to-prisoners-send-money.name: Send money to someone in prison
money-to-prisoners-send-money.description: You can use this service to make a payment by debit card. We accept Visa, Mastercard and Maestro debit cards. You can also find out how to make a UK bank transfer to a prisoner by online banking, mobile banking app, telephone banking

access-your-teaching-qualifications.name: Access your teaching qualifications
access-your-teaching-qualifications.description: Qualified teachers can use this service to download your teaching certificates, check qualification and early career teacher induction status and change the name on your teaching certificates.

Dfe.Academies.External.name: Apply to become an Academy
Dfe.Academies.External.description: Application processes for mainstream and special schools applying to convert to academy status.

apply-for-teacher-training.name: Apply for teacher training
apply-for-teacher-training.description: Use this service to apply for a postgraduate teacher training course to teach in a state primary or secondary school, or in further education.

teacher-pay-calculator.name: Calculate teacher pay
teacher-pay-calculator.description: Calculate teacher pay following the 2023 pay award

early-years-foundation-recovery.name: Early years child development training
early-years-foundation-recovery.description: A free, online training course providing an overview of child development and giving practical advice for supporting the development of children in your early years setting.

claim-additional-payments-for-teaching.name: Claim Additional Payments for Teaching
claim-additional-payments-for-teaching.description: You may be eligible for early-career payments if you teach chemistry, languages, mathematics or physics.

fh-services.name: Manage family support services and accounts
fh-services.description: This service is for people working in local authorities or voluntary and community sector organisations. It allows you to manage your organisation and services on Connect families to support and Find support for your family.

childrens-social-care-cpd.name: Develop your career in child and family social work
childrens-social-care-cpd.description: Find development programmes for child and family social workers at different stages of your career.

eapim-developer-hub.name: Find and Use an API
eapim-developer-hub.description: Connect to the Department for Education (DfE) digital services through our APIs.

find-a-lost-trn.name: Find a lost teacher reference number (TRN)
find-a-lost-trn.description: Use this service to find your teacher reference number (TRN) if you do not know it or have forgotten it, or to check if you have a TRN.

teaching-school-hub-finder.name: Find a teaching school hub
teaching-school-hub-finder.description: Use this service to find the contact details and websites of teaching school hubs near you.

npd-find-and-explore.name: National Pupil Database (NPD)
npd-find-and-explore.description: Use this tool to find and explore information about the data that is held in the NPD, a key DfE data store, covering education, skills and children services data for individual learners in England.

publish-teacher-training.name: Publish teacher training courses
publish-teacher-training.description: Use this service to publish information about initial teacher training courses.

buy-for-your-school.name: Get help buying for schools
buy-for-your-school.description: Use this service to create a specification for a new catering service for a single school in England.

get-help-to-retrain.name: Get help to retrain
get-help-to-retrain.description: The service allowed users to create an action plan to help them identify another type of work they could move into and what training might be available nearby to support them in their application.

get-help-with-tech.name: Get help with technology
get-help-with-tech.description: Information for local authorities, academy trusts and schools about the devices, internet access and support available to provide remote education and access to children’s social care during coronavirus (COVID-19).

get-information-about-schools.name: Get information about schools
get-information-about-schools.description: This is a register of schools and colleges in England. You can search for and download information on establishments, establishment groups or governors. Schools, local authorities and academy trusts can also update details by signing in to their Secure Access account.

get-into-teaching-app.name: Get Into Teaching
get-into-teaching-app.description: A service which aims to inspire, inform and support people who are interested in training to become a teacher.

get-teacher-training-adviser-service.name: Get an adviser
get-teacher-training-adviser-service.description: If you’re thinking about teaching in England, an adviser can provide free, one-to-one support through phone, text or email.

improve-workload-and-wellbeing-for-schoo.name: Improve workload and wellbeing for school staff
improve-workload-and-wellbeing-for-schoo.description: Use the service to help you promote staff wellbeing and support workload reduction in your school, with free resources that are produced by school leaders, for school leaders, support what you’re already doing and can be adapted to work in your school.

early-careers-framework.name: Manage training for early career teachers
early-careers-framework.description: This service is for induction tutors who have been nominated by their school Use this service to manage your school’s statutory induction programme for early career teachers.

plan-technology-for-your-school.name: Plan technology for your school
plan-technology-for-your-school.description: This is a self-assessment service to determine how your school is using technology and what your school can do to use technology better in future.

cpd-information.name: Professional development for teachers and leaders
cpd-information.description: Take a specialist national professional qualification (NPQ) to enhance and develop your existing skills and knowledge both inside and outside of the classroom.

refer-serious-misconduct.name: Refer serious misconduct by a teacher in England
refer-serious-misconduct.description: The Teaching Regulation Agency (TRA) will investigate cases where the misconduct is serious enough to potentially result in a teacher being stopped from teaching (known as a ‘prohibition order’).

npq-registration.name: Register for a National Professional Qualification
npq-registration.description: This service is for teachers who want to register to study for a National Professional Qualification (NPQ).

register-trainee-teachers.name: Register trainee teachers
register-trainee-teachers.description: Register trainees with the Department for Education and record the outcome of their training.

schools-experience.name: Get school experience
schools-experience.description: Use this service if you want to request school experience in a primary or secondary school in England.

support-for-early-career-teachers.name: Support for early career teachers
support-for-early-career-teachers.description: Use this service to access training and support materials for the Early Career Framework (ECF), accredited by the Department for Education.

teaching-vacancies.name: Teaching Vacancies
teaching-vacancies.description: Search for a job in teaching in England by subject or role, location, salary, full-time and part-time jobs, and by primary education and secondary education.

appeal-planning-decision.name: Appeal a planning decision
appeal-planning-decision.description: You can appeal a householder planning decision if you were refused permission for reasons that you think go against the local planning authority’s development plan or planning policy.
organisation: Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

applications-service.name: Find a National Infrastructure Project
applications-service.description: Find information about Nationally Significant Infrastructure Projects (NSIPs). These are large scale projects like power stations, highways and power lines. They are treated separately from normal local authority planning because of their size and importance to wider communities.
organisation: Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

links.text: News story: New online hub launches for National Infrastructure Projects

nfdiv-frontend.name: Apply for a divorce
nfdiv-frontend.description: You can use this service to apply for a divorce in England and Wales.

links.text: New divorce laws will come into force from 6 April 2022
“Blame game” ends as no-fault divorce comes into force

probate-frontend.name: Apply for Probate
probate-frontend.description: Applying for the legal right to deal with someone’s property, money and possessions (their ‘estate’) when they die is called ‘applying for probate’.

cmc-legal-rep-frontend.name: Money Claims
cmc-legal-rep-frontend.description: You can make a money claim if you think a person or organisation owes you money and will not pay you back.

innovation-funding-service.name: Apply for innovation funding
synonyms: Apply for an Innovation funding grant
innovation-funding-service.description: Lets users who are looking for funding to complete their innovative projects apply to comptitions to win a grant.

das-employerapprenticeshipsservice.name: Manage apprenticeships
das-employerapprenticeshipsservice.description: This service is for organisations that want to take on apprentices. Use this service to set up and manage apprenticeship training and pay for apprenticeship training.

das-findapprenticeshiptraining.name: Find apprenticeship training for your apprentice
synonyms: Find apprenticeship training if you're an employer
das-findapprenticeshiptraining.description: If you’re an employer, you can find training for your apprentices.

bereavement.name: Apply for Bereavement Support Payment
bereavement.description: You may be able to get Bereavement Support Payment if your husband, wife or civil partner died in the last 21 months.

brp_enquiry_forms.name: Biometric Residence Permits
brp_enquiry_forms.description: A biometric residence permit (BRP) can be used to confirm your identit, right to study or work in the UK or right to any public services or benefits you’re entitled to.
brp_enquiry_forms.theme: Citizenship and living in the UK

undefined.name: Apply for a passport
synonyms: Apply online for a UK passport
undefined.description: Use this service to apply for, renew, replace or update your passport and pay for it online.

gro.name: Order a birth, death, marriage or civil partnership certificate
gro.description: You need to register on the General Register Office (GRO) website to get a copy of a birth, adoption, death, marriage or civil partnership certificate in England and Wales.

home-office-design-system.name: Home Office Design System
home-office-design-system.description: Documenting common ways of solving problems - helping to reduce multiplied effort. Filling the gaps between GDS guidance and Home Office services.

modern-slavery.name: Report modern slavery
synonyms: Report modern slavery as a first responder
modern-slavery.description: First responders can use the National Referral Mechanism (NRM) to report cases of modern slavery and refer potential victims for support and protection.

rotm.name: Report online material promoting terrorism or extremism
rotm.description: Report illegal or harmful information, pictures or videos you’ve found on the internet. You can make your report anonymously.
rotm.theme: Citizenship and living in the UK

right-to-rent-check.name: View a tenant's right to rent in England
right-to-rent-check.description: View a tenant's right to rent if they have a biometric residence card, biometric residence permit, settled or pre-settled status, or applied for a visa and used the ‘UK Immigration: ID Check’ app to scan their identity document on their phone.
right-to-rent-check.theme: Citizenship and living in the UK

rod-licensing.name: Get a rod fishing licence
synonyms: Buy a Rod Fishing Licence for England & Wales
rod-licensing.description: You can buy a 1-day, 8-day or 12-month licence online.

fmp-app.name: Flood map for planning
fmp-app.description: This service is for learning about a site location's flood probability as part of development planning.

flood-app.name: Check for flooding
flood-app.description: Use this service to check current flood warnings or alerts, river, sea, groundwater and rainfall levels and flood risk in the next 5 days.

rod-catch-returns-frontend.name: Report your salmon or sea trout catch
synonyms: Report a catch return (England and Wales)
rod-catch-returns-frontend.description: You must report how many salmon and sea trout you’ve caught if you have a migratory salmon and sea trout rod licence.

flood-xws-contact-web.name: Sign up for flood warnings
flood-xws-contact-web.description: Sign up to get warnings in England by phone, email or text message if your home or business is at risk of flooding. The service is free.

carers-allowance-prototype.name: Apply for Carer’s Allowance
carers-allowance-prototype.description: Lets users who care for another person for more than 35 hours a week get a regular payment so that they can carry on giving care.

csra-app.name: Cell Sharing Risk Assessment application
csra-app.description: Assess if a prisoner can share a cell safely

global-uk-tariff.name: Check UK trade tariffs from 1 January 2021
global-uk-tariff.description: Use this service to check the UK Global Tariff that will apply to goods you import from 1 January 2021. You can also check the difference between what you pay now and what you’ll pay from 1 January 2021.

payment-practices-reporting.name: Payment practices reporting
payment-practices-reporting.description: Large businesses must publish information about their payment terms and practices, and how they keep to them.

energy-label-service.name: Create an energy label
energy-label-service.description: Create a label for an energy-related product (ErP) that you make or sell to UK customers, for example white goods, boilers and other household appliances.

beis-opss-psd.name: Product safety database
beis-opss-psd.description: Report, track and share product safety information with the product safety community
organisation: Office for Product Safety and Standards

beis-report-official-development-assista.name: Report your Official Development Assistance
beis-report-official-development-assista.description: This service is for reporting research and innovation Official Development Assistance.

beis-opss-cosmetics.name: Submit cosmetic product notifications
beis-opss-cosmetics.description: Notify the Office for Product Safety and Standards (OPSS) about cosmetic products available to consumers in Great Britain (GB).
organisation: Office for Product Safety and Standards

paas-product-pages.name: GOV.UK Platform as a Service
paas-product-pages.description: Modern web hosting for government services. You can get something up on the Internet in minutes, without depending on a webops team.

links.text: Why we’ve decided to decommission GOV.UK PaaS (Platform as a Service)

govuk-coronavirus-business-volunteer-for.name: Offer coronavirus support from your business
govuk-coronavirus-business-volunteer-for.description: Use this service to tell us how your business might be able to help with the response to coronavirus (COVID-19).

govuk-shielded-vulnerable-people-service.name: Get support if you’re clinically extremely vulnerable to coronavirus
govuk-shielded-vulnerable-people-service.description: Use this service if you have a medical condition which means you’re classed as being clinically extremely vulnerable to coronavirus.

govuk-design-system.name: GOV.UK Design System
govuk-design-system.description: Use this design system to make your service consistent with GOV.UK. Learn from the research and experience of other service teams and avoid repeating work that’s already been done.

govuk-coronavirus-find-support.name: Find out what support you can get if you’re affected by coronavirus
govuk-coronavirus-find-support.description: Use this service to find out what help and advice you can get from the government and other organisations. You can use it for yourself or someone else.

travel-advice-publisher.name: Foreign travel advice
travel-advice-publisher.description: Get advice about travelling abroad, including the latest information on coronavirus, safety and security, entry requirements and travel warnings.

forms-api-prototype.name: GOV.UK Forms
forms-api-prototype.description: Create an accessible online form in minutes without needing technical knowledge.

links.text: Blog post: Making it easy to create and publish digital forms on GOV.UK
News story: New online claims form launched to benefit redundancy claimants

items.label: Assessed as amber at beta stage

frontend.name: GOV.UK
frontend.description: The best place to find government services and information.

sourceCode.text: Source code for the homepage, transactions and some index pages
Source code for finder and search pages for GOV.UK

notifications-admin.name: GOV.UK Notify
notifications-admin.description: Try GOV.UK Notify now if you work in central government, a local authority, or the NHS.

datagovuk_find.name: Find open data
datagovuk_find.description: Find data published by central government, local authorities and public bodies to help you build products and services

pay-frontend.name: GOV.UK Pay
pay-frontend.description: GOV.UK Pay is a secure payment service that is easy to integrate with and designed to meet the Digital Service Standard. Give your users a trusted GOV.UK-branded payment experience.

platforms-product-page.name: GOV.UK UK Government Security
platforms-product-page.description: This website is where people across the UK government can find security-related strategies, standards, and guidance, along with the organisations involved in the security profession.

govuk-prototype-kit.name: GOV.UK Prototype Kit
govuk-prototype-kit.description: Rapidly create HTML prototypes of GOV.UK services.

govwifi-product-page.name: GovWifi
govwifi-product-page.description: GovWifi is a wifi authentication service allowing staff and visitors to use a single username and password to connect to guest wifi across the public sector.

fco-consular-appointments-slotpicker.name: Book consular appointments
fco-consular-appointments-slotpicker.description: The British consulate can provide a range of notarial and documentary services for British nationals

legalisation-prototype.name: Get your document legalised
legalisation-prototype.description: You can get certain official UK documents ‘legalised’ by asking the Legalisation Office to confirm that the signature, stamp or seal is from a UK public official. You might need to do this if an official in another country has asked you to provide a UK document and they’ve said it must be legalised. The Legalisation Office will check the document, including whether the signature, stamp or seal is genuine. They’ll legalise the document by attaching a stamped official certificate (an ‘apostille’) to it. You can’t get documents issued outside the UK legalised using this service - get them legalised in the country they were issued.

emergency-travel-documents.name: Apply for an emergency travel document
emergency-travel-documents.description: You can only get an emergency travel document if you're abroad. If the person needing to travel is currently in the UK they should apply for a passport. An emergency travel document is normally issued within 2 working days and can sometimes be done within 24 hours. It costs £100 or the equivalent in local currency which can be paid online or in the consulate.

verify-apostille-service.name: Verify an apostille
verify-apostille-service.description: Use this service if you want to verify an Apostille certificate issued in the UK.

coronavirus-dashboard.name: Coronavirus (COVID-19) in the UK
coronavirus-dashboard.description: The official UK Government website for data and insights on Coronavirus (COVID-19).

links.text: Blog post: UKHSA data dashboard takes over from the Coronavirus (COVID-19) dashboard

digitalmarketplace-supplier-frontend.name: Digital Marketplace
digitalmarketplace-supplier-frontend.description: Find technology or people for digital projects in the public sector.

Fitness-to-Drive-Pageflow.name: Driving with a medical condition
synonyms: Check if a health condition affects your driving
Renew your short-term medical driving licence
Fitness-to-Drive-Pageflow.description: The service allows citizens who are drivers to tell DVLA about a relevant medical condition or renew their existing medical driving licence. The project is delivering a new online notification service enabling customers to tell DVLA about their medical condition, and a similar service enabling customers to renew their existing medical driving licence.

vdr-core.name: View your driving licence information
synonyms: View or share your driving licence information
Add a driving licence check code to your mobile phone
vdr-core.description: You can use this service to view your driving record, for example vehicles you can drive, check your penalty points or disqualifications or create a licence ‘check code’ to share your driving record with someone, for example a car hire company.

tellacas.name: Find a solution for your employment dispute
tellacas.description: This service allows claimants or their representatives to notify ACAS of a workplace dispute and choose whether they want early conciliation or to get a certificate to the employment tribunal for a judge to decide.

epb-frontend.name: Get a new energy certificate
epb-frontend.description: To get a new energy certificate for your home, business property or a public building, you need to have it assessed. Find an accredited assessor for your home, business property or a public building.
organisation: Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

sourceCode.text: Energy performance of buildings register front end
Energy performance of buildings register api
Energy performance of buildings register auth server
Energy performance of buildings register data warehouse
Energy performance of buildings register infrastructure

submit-social-housing-lettings-and-sales.name: Submit social housing lettings and sales data (CORE)
synonyms: Submit Data On Social Housing Sales And Lettings
submit-social-housing-lettings-and-sales.description: Staff at Local Authorities and Housing Associations use this service to submit data about each new social housing letting or sale in England. This data is collected by DLUHC on an annual basis, is released as official national statistics on GOV.UK and informs social housing and homelessness policy.
organisation: Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

gap-find-apply-web.name: Find a grant
gap-find-apply-web.description: Browse a list of available government grants and see if you're eligible to apply for them.

items.label: Apply for a grant feature launched

links.text: Blog post: An update to Find a Grant - Apply for a Grant!
Blog post: The first GOV.UK release of the Find a Grant pilot is now open - for everyone

gender-pay-gap.name: Gender pay gap service
gender-pay-gap.description: Use this service to find gender pay gap data for organisations in the UK.

life-chances-fund.name: Access life chances fund
life-chances-fund.theme: Citizenship and living in the UK

has-nomination-form.name: Honours nomination
has-nomination-form.description: ou can nominate someone for an honour online.
has-nomination-form.theme: Citizenship and living in the UK

hof.name: Home Office Forms
hof.description: HOF (Home Office Forms) is a framework designed to assist developers in creating form-based workflows in a rapid, repeatable and secure way. It aims to reduce simple applications as much as possible to being configuration-only.

mot.name: MOT testing service
mot.description: Use this service if you’re an MOT tester and you need to record results of MOTs you carry out, print MOT certificates or buy test slots and check your test station’s balance.

undefined.name: 111 online
undefined.description: 111 online can help if you have a medical problem and you're not sure what to do.

digital-land.info.name: planning.data.gov.uk
digital-land.info.description: A platform to help you create services to inform planning and housing decisions in England.
organisation: Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

qae.name: King's Awards for Enterprise
qae.description: The King’s Awards for Enterprise are for outstanding achievement by UK businesses in the categories of: innovation, international trade, sustainable development, promoting opportunity through social mobility

qavs-v2.name: The King’s Award for Voluntary Service
synonyms: The Queen’s Award for Voluntary Service
qavs-v2.description: The King’s Award for Voluntary Service is the highest award given to volunteer groups across the UK.
organisation: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport
qavs-v2.theme: Citizenship and living in the UK

rps-alpha.name: Claim for redundancy and monies owed
synonyms: Claim for redundancy and other money you’re owed by an employer
rps-alpha.description: Use this service to claim money if your employer owes you a redundancy payment or other money like wages, holiday and commission.

onboarding-product-page.name: GOV.UK One Login
synonyms: GOV.UK Sign in: End-user digital identity checks
onboarding-product-page.description: GOV.UK One Login in is the new way for government services to sign in their users

items.label: Service renamed as GOV.UK One Login
Passed alpha assessment: End-user digital identity checks

links.visuallyHiddenText: for alpha assessment (end-user digital identity checks)

trade-tariff-frontend.name: Look up commodity codes, import duties, taxes and controls (UK Integrated Online Tariff)
synonyms: Trade Tariff: look up commodity codes, duty and VAT rates
trade-tariff-frontend.description: Commodity codes classify goods for import and export so you can: fill in declarations and other paperwork, check if there’s duty or VAT to pay, find out about duty reliefs.

update-your-capital-schemes.name: Update your capital schemes
update-your-capital-schemes.description: Service for local authorities to provide updates on the progress of their Active Travel Fund capital projects
